insight: A small error in the payroll application could lead to widespread financial discrepancies affecting all employees' compensations.

Introduction of the Mandatory Human Role rule ensures accountability, but a misassignment or inadequate training of the developer role could lead to significant operational disruptions in application maintenance, causing system failures or compliance issues.

Changes in developer protocols or application deployment rules can drastically alter the stability and functionality of critical systems, like the payroll app, leading to unforeseen organizational disruptions.

The rule requiring a human role associated with each application leads to a system where small changes in role definition or assignment practices can significantly alter the compliance status and risk profile of the entire organization.

A delay in updating the payroll app due to dependencies on developer availability and compliance with the Mandatory Human Role rule can result in multiplied negative impacts, such as delayed employee payments and reduced moral.
